title: Brimah Kebbie
text:
Brimah Kebbie (born ) is an English former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who played in the 1980s and 1990s, and current rugby union <a href="Coach%20%28sports%29">coach</a>. He played club level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>, <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> (two spells) and <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>, as a , and club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Saracens%20F.C.">Saracens F.C.</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23wing">wing</a>, he coached club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="London%20Nigerian%20RFC">London Nigerian RFC</a><a href="http%3A//www.londonnigerianrugby.com/"></a>, <a href="Imperial%20College%20London">Imperial College London</a><a href="https%3A//icurfc.co.uk/"></a>, and <a href="Hillingdon%20Abbots%20RFC">Hillingdon</a> <a href="Old%20Abbotstonians%20RFC">Abbotstonians</a> (in <a href="Hayes%2C%20Hillingdon">Hayes, Hillingdon</a>) in the <a href="Herts/Middlesex%202">Herts/Middlesex 2</a> league, and <a href="Strength%20and%20conditioning%20coach">Strength and conditioning coach</a> at <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>.
During the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1989–90 season</a>, Brimah Kebbie was an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> for defending champions Widnes in the 30-18 victory over the visiting <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> in the <a href="1989%20World%20Club%20Challenge">1989</a> <a href="World%20Club%20Series">World Club Challenge</a> at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>, <a href="Manchester">Manchester</a> on Wednesday 4 October 1989.
Brimah Kebbie played for <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> when they finished as runners-up to <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> during the <a href="1993%E2%80%9394%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1993–94 season</a>.
Personal life.
Brimah Kebbie is the father of the (soccer) <a href="association%20football">association football</a>er; <a href="Elliot%20Kebbie">Elliot Kebbie</a>.
